p: The average of MW presented by conventional anti-TB drugs [ 48] (358.5 g·mol −1) contrasted with our NPs that typically had lower binding energies (MW > 500 g·mol −1). However, the number of H-bonds acceptors of the NPs matched those of H-bonds acceptors of conventional anti-TB drugs [ 48], the majority of which were below 10 H-bonds acceptors. The same is observed with the number of rotational bonds, since 88% of conventional anti-TB drugs have less than 10 rotational bonds [ 48].
